sentence.Network_en: The targets would not be achieved unless other departments showed equal commitment.

entry.def: Commitment is a strong belief in an idea or system.

example.tran: 对布尔什维克主义理想的信奉

entry.def: A commitment is something which regularly takes up some of your time because of an agreement you have made or because of responsibilities that you have.

example.ex: I've got a lot of commitments...
Work commitments forced her to uproot herself and her son from Reykjavik.
example.tran: 她的工作迫使她和儿子从雷克雅未克搬走。

entry.def: If you make a commitment to do something, you promise that you will do it.

example.ex: We made a commitment to keep working together...
They made a commitment to peace.

entry.def: Commitment is the process of officially sending someone to a prison or to hospital.

means.word_mean: 1. the trait of sincere and steadfast fixity of purpose;
2. the act of binding yourself (intellectually or emotionally) to a course of action;

sentences.sentence: "they felt no loyalty to a losing team"

means.word_mean: 3. an engagement by contract involving financial obligation;

sentences.sentence: "his business commitments took him to London"

means.word_mean: 4. a message that makes a pledge
5. the official act of consigning a person to confinement (as in a prison or mental hospital)

Sentence.sentence: "If you ask Japanese students to list the positive attributes they expect in a romantic partner, they rate highly things like loyalty, commitment and devotion," says O'Sullivan.
they lay more emphasis on commitment and devotion
They have jobs and other commitments.

sentences.en: He made a commitment to pay the rent on time.
I am very tired because I have taken on so many commitments.
sentences.cn: 我很累, 因为我承担了很多的事情。

sentences.en: They are looking for someone with a real sense of commitment to the job.
